page.title: 05PASS OFF PARADE
page.content: We went to Helles Barracks the home of the 11th.Signal Regiment to watch the Pass Off Parade;at the gates we were met by a Corporal and escourted to our seats.The Parade Sergeant Major ordered the six flag carrying markers to march on ;as one of the Corporal markers passed us he said,{"Hi Kids"}. A most deafening shriek came from the Sgt.Major,but really he was calling for the Regimental Band from Blandford to march on playing {Glorious Victory} .They were followed by three groups of recruits.The first group,in smart uniforms and white belts,were the Pass Off troops who had completed 10 weeks training.The other two groups had completed 6 or 8 weeks training.They marched around the square to {Holy {Rood},stopped,and stood at ease waiting for the Inspecting Officer.It was to be Brigadier Maynard.
